completed_projects.description:
Tasks 924, 922, and 916 have hit major issues. Problematic ideas to remove:

1. Standard witness families are CONSTANT (same MCS at every time) - needs systematic fix to admit families with different MCSs at different times
2. Truth lemma assumed only needed for eval family - hits dead end for complex formulas
3. Taking all MCSs to form a single canonical family does not work

The correct path:
1. Define MCSs as world states
2. Define four-constraint accessibility relation: one MCS related to another iff whenever Box G phi is in the left MCS, then phi is in the right MCS
3. Define families as functions Int -> MCS where each MCS sees the next MCS or is seen by the previous MCS (using the accessibility relation)
4. This constructs a bundle of families resembling world histories
5. Prove every consistent sentence belongs to an MCS at time 0 in some family
6. Establish TruthLemma: sentence belongs to MCS in family iff sentence is true when evaluated at that family at the corresponding integer

This construction is the core of the representation theorem. It may be hard to find but once found will be obviously correct and relatively easy to verify.

artifacts.summary: Team research: restructured truth predicate + CanonicalMCS domain is recommended path (2 teammates)
Team research round 2: corrected BoxG/BoxH constraints, C2 gap identified (2 teammates)
Restructured truth-predicate: semantic faithfulness analysis - modification is safe because it only affects metalogic tool, not theory semantics
Team research round 4 (4 teammates): non-transitive task relation, BoxGContent correctness, chain-based families, constant family elimination, density/three-place analysis
10-phase implementation plan for chain-based BMCS completeness redesign (24 hours)
Sorry-free completeness chain: chainBundleBMCS + weak/strong completeness theorems via CanonicalBC domain (9/10 phases, Phase 2 boneyard cleanup skipped)

completed_projects.completion_summary: Proved sorry-free weak and strong completeness theorems for bimodal TM logic using chain-bundle BMCS construction over CanonicalBC domain with modified truth semantics. All theorems depend only on standard Lean axioms (no sorry, no custom axioms). Key innovation: Box case uses MCS membership directly, requiring temporal coherence only for the evaluated family.

completed_projects.description: Formalize the frame correspondence theorem to show that the linearity axiom characterizes linear frames. This theorem proves: if the linearity axiom schema F(p) AND F(q) -> F(p AND q) OR F(p AND F(q)) OR F(F(p) AND q) is valid on a Kripke frame, then the frame's accessibility relation is linear. Required to complete task 922's Phase 3 blocker (canonical_reachable_linear theorem).

artifacts.summary: Deep analysis of frame correspondence for linearity axiom; identifies Case 3 infinite regress as fundamental difficulty; recommends G-enriched linearity trick or strict-future translation approach
